title: Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service: Real-Time
description: ***Note: As of 12/22/23, Law Enforcement Calls for Service data related to calls that originated from the 311 Connected Worker app and were dispatched from the Healthy Streets Operations Center (HSOC) have been recoded to better capture the nature of these calls. These calls were previously categorized as "on view" calls and were hard to distinguish from other types of "on view" calls for service where a San Francisco Police Department unit were dispatched based on viewing an incident in the field. They will now be identified using a new value in the onview_flag data field of "HSOC." This affects historic data as well as new data in the Law Enforcement Calls for Service datasets. *** A. SUMMARY Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service – Real-time dataset includes all calls for service which generate a record in the Department of Emergency Management's Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) System, and typically have a law enforcement unit dispatched to the location. Calls originate from the public via calls to the 911 call center or from law enforcement officers in the field upon viewing an incident (‘On-View’). The Real-time dataset is delayed by 10 minutes, and represents a rolling 48 hour window of calls for service. It contains both open and closed calls and is updated every 10 minutes. It is delayed by 10 minutes. Open calls are active calls that are unverified, but being worked by law enforcement. Closed calls are calls that law enforcement have indicated are resolved. Not all Calls for Service generate a Police Incident Report, so data does not directly correlate to the Police Incidents Report dataset. The dataset contains calls handled by law enforcement which can include Police, MTA parking enforcement, the Sheriff’s Office, and others. All relevant time intervals are also included. Some Calls for Service data is suppressed, due to the nature of the call and privacy concerns related to the incident. Please refer Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service Explainer for full documentation B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Once a received 911 call is dispatched, a record (CAD#) is generated in the Department of Emergency Management's Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) System. C. UPDATE PROCESS Updated every 10 minutes with the past 48hrs of open and closed calls that have been dispatched. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Please refer Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service Explainer for full documentation E. KEY RELATED DATASETS Datasets: Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service: Closed Calls Police Department Incident Reports: 2018 to Present Fire Department Calls for Service Geographic Boundaries: Current Police Districts Analysis Neighborhoods Supervisor Districts

columns.name: cad_number
columns.description: Unique 9-digit number assigned by the 911 Dispatch Center (DEM) to this call. Both Police and Fire Depts use these numbers

columns.name: received_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 Dispatch Center receives the call or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident.

columns.name: entry_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 operator submits the initial call information into the CAD system or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident.

columns.name: dispatch_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 operator dispatches the first unit to the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident.

columns.name: enroute_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the first unit acknowledges the dispatch and records that they are enroute to the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident.

columns.name: onscene_datetime
columns.description: Date and time the first unit records arriving at the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: close_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the last unit responding closes the call

columns.name: call_type_original
columns.description: Call type code as originally coded/selected by dispatcher

columns.name: call_type_original_desc
columns.description: Standard description of original call type

columns.name: call_type_original_notes
columns.description: Any notes regarding the original call type entered by the dispatcher

columns.name: call_type_final
columns.description: Final call type code as coded/selected by dispatcher. For closed calls this is the last call type code. For open calls this code may continue to change.

columns.name: call_type_final_desc
columns.description: Standard description of final call type

columns.name: call_type_final_notes
columns.description: Any notes regarding the final call type entered by the dispatcher

columns.name: priority_orginal
columns.description: Priority level originally coded by dispatcher

columns.name: priority_final
columns.description: Final priority level for closed calls and most recent priority level for open calls

columns.name: agency
columns.description: Primary agency assigned (Police, Sheriff, or MTA). Multiple units from different agencies may respond but only one agency will be identified as the primary responder

columns.name: disposition
columns.description: Disposition of call

columns.name: onview_flag
columns.description: Indicates whether the associated cad_number originated from a 911 call (onview_flag = N) or from a law enforcement unit viewing an incident in the field (onview_flag = Y)

columns.name: sensitive_call
columns.description: Indicates whether the call is flagged as sensitive. Location information is suppressed for sensitive call types

columns.name: intersection_name
columns.description: Name of intersection used to anonymize the incident location

columns.name: intersection_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the intersection_point used to anonymize the incident location

columns.name: intersection_point
columns.description: Geographic point representing the anonymized incident location (nearest intersection)

columns.name: supervisor_district
columns.description: Supervisor district based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: analysis_neighborhood
columns.description: Analysis Neighborhoods based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: police_district
columns.description: Police District based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: call_last_updated_at
columns.description: Exact timestamp when call log was last updated

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Exact timestamp when a data file was last extracted from the source CAD system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Exact timestamp when data was last loaded here (into the open data portal)
